law.catch_line: Duty of officer in advertising sale under execution -- Returning equitable writ -- Defense.

text.section: No officer shall delay advertising property for sale, taken by him under execution, for more than twenty days after the levy.
No officer shall fail to return by the return day thereof any writ of execution or attachment for not performing a judgment in chancery or equity which is placed in his hands to execute.

It shall be no defense to an action or motion against a collecting officer for failure of duty of himself or deputy that the plaintiff directed the officer to delay or in any way stay proceedings thereon unless the defense is supported by the written consent or request of the plaintiff or his agent or attorney.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 1712, 1713, 1714.
